means: <正>（尤指为表示礼貌或耐心而）克制，忍耐，容忍( forbear的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Thank you for being so forbearing.
He has a forbearing nature; he accepts trouble with a smile.
sentence.Network_cn: 他天生容忍, 遇到麻烦都能一笑了事.

sentence.Network_en: I have been so far forbearing with you.

PerfectNetExp.abs: GRE逆序_馆档网 ... overbearing 专横的，独断的 forbearing 忍耐的，宽容的 searing 灼热的.
forbearance n．自制，忍耐forbearing adj．忍耐的，宽容的forbidding adj．（表情）冷峻的，形势险恶的.
I found him a very patient , very forbearing , and yet an exacting master ., 我发现他是一个很有耐心 , 很有自制力 , 然而又是一个要求严格的老师.
forbearance 耐性, forbearing 能忍耐的, forbearance 隐忍

entry.def: Someone who is forbearing behaves in a calm and sensible way at a time when they would have a right to be very upset or angry.

means.word_mean: 1. showing patient and unruffled self-control and restraint under adversity; slow to retaliate or express resentment;

sentences.sentence: "seemly and forbearing...yet strong enough to resist aggression"
"was longanimous in the face of suffering"

sentences.en: He has a forbearing nature; he accepts trouble with a smile.
sentences.cn: 他天生容忍，遇到麻烦都能一笑了事。
